<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Pirate Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2032) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 185 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Pirate](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=70)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7)

</column>

---

As a pirate, you sail the seas in search of enemy ships to plunder. You become trained in [Sailing Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8), or become an expert in it if you were already trained. You ignore the effects of difficult terrain or uneven ground caused by a ship's movement. Additionally, you gain the Boarding Assault action.

**Boarding Assault** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Flourish](/Traits.aspx?ID=73)) Either Stride twice or attempt an [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) check (DC determined by the GM, but usually DC 20) to swing on a rope up to twice your Speed. If you boarded or disembarked from a boat or similar vehicle during this movement, you can make a melee Strike that deals one additional weapon damage die.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the pirate archetype.

<title level="2">Pirate Dedication leads to...</title>
[Broadside Buckos](/Feats.aspx?ID=4133), [Cutting Flattery](/Feats.aspx?ID=4138), [Hook 'Em](/Feats.aspx?ID=4147), [Pirate Weapon Training](/Feats.aspx?ID=2033), [Rope Runner](/Feats.aspx?ID=2034), [Walk the Plank](/Feats.aspx?ID=2035), [Watch This!](/Feats.aspx?ID=4140)
name: Pirate Dedication
